newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish bonds track bunds easier, crown dips.
newsitem.headline: Swedish bonds track bunds easier, crown dips.

text.p: Swedish yields climbed quite sharply in line with weaker foreign markets at Thursday midday, but only slightly underperformed bunds amid a gentle crown weakening, with the spread widening one basis point to 89.
Dealers said bond weakness mainly stemmed from a failure by bund futures to rise through technical resistance.
A clear recoil they had expected in the crown after sharp gains versus the mark on Wednesday did not materialise, with trade thin, dealers said.
Markets across Europe suffered mild renewed EMU wobbles after a French daily suggested the French deficit may come out higher than Germany would accept.
Trade was also subdued ahead of a widely expected Bank of England decision to hike key rates by at least 25 basis points.

The six-month T-bill rate dropped one basis point to 4.11 percent, with the 10-year bond yield up five basis points to 6.46 percent. The crown softened marginally to 4.3785 versus 4.3770 crowns on Wednesday.
